content.description: Start on two sidepulling cracks and carefully work your way up to a sloping ledge. grab the undercling above your head and traverse left to the top out.
content.location:
GPS  coords: N 33.55806° W 117.25548°

Up the hill from the trail

content.description:
Start on the tall end of the crack line on 1 triangle hold and a slopey jug.

Follow the crack line to the shorter side where you can use some facial features to top the crack.
content.location:
GPS coords: N 33.56415° W 117.25820°

Top of the hill near Obama Prism on the left side of the trail.

content.description: Start on two of the best holds of the entire climb. climb up with left hand grabbing arete, finish to the right.

Start low sidepulling against large features of the rock. Kicking your right leg out to the closest foothold. Continue up to a compression move until you have your feet situated.

Top out is the crux (for me). slopey holds.

Downclimb is a lil sketch.
content.location:
Follow the trail left into the hills. The boulder has another leaning against it.

GPS coordinates "N 33.56333° W 117.25799° "

content.description: A sloping crack running diagonally across the rock face. Sit start on the checkerboard carved lower piece and move into the crack to a fairly chill mantle.
content.location: from the waishal trail. Hike past the trail sign all the way to where the trail levels out at the top. Continue on the trail and three very distinct boulders should come into view.

content.description: The hardest part is in the middle of the route when moving the left hand farther in the crack with little for the right hand to hold onto.
content.location: Start to right of The Praying Hands and follow the crack of the right thumb on the front face of the rock to top-out. Walk to the back to get down.

content.description:
Start on 2 bad crimps, bump to the crack rail where the best holds of the climb are. Top out is crux, since there are basically no holds. I had to mantle off the tiny horizontal crack

I've added lots of photos

I call it Groundhogs Day slab, because you may have to repeat the moves over and over lol
content.location:
right side of the trail, top of the hill. easy to spot!

GPS location: N 33.56719° W 117.25727°

content.description:
Thin handjam sit start, that widens into a fist jam. Easy fun little climb.

Beta:

https://www.instagram.com/p/B-3NYppj0_S/
content.location:
Behind The Praying Hands.

Up the trail on the right side.

GPS coords: N 33.56446° W 117.25531°

content.description:
Easy, low-risk problem.

Start low underclinging/jamming the offwidth. You can get a really secure calf lock in it, follow the crack line to the top!
content.location:
Left side of the trail, up the hill with pretty lardge/obvious crack facial feauture on the rock

GPS coordinates: N 33.56319° W 117.25622°

content.description: Start next to a large flakey feature. You'll know what i'm talking about cause it's one of the few features of the boulder. Go straight up doing delicate slab climbing.
content.location:
Directly across from the ending of slums of shaolin.

GPS coords: N 33.56415° W 117.25820°

Top of the hill near Obama Prism on the left side of the trail.

content.description: A quick hard power move with an inverted thumb crimp allows for the slopper finish to summit the rock.
content.protection: crash pad recommended not necessary with spotters
content.location: This boulder problem is located on the west face of Black Beard Rock, left of the V6 problem Black Beard. Walk off the back side to get down.

content.description: Start in crack and work your way up to the larger split in the rock.
content.location: Large boulder on the hillside with a large prominent crack. You can see it from miles away

content.description: There is not much that you can do for your feet on this one so hold on tight. Be careful of rock debris on the top, makes it hard to hold on.
content.protection: two crash-pads would be prime for this boulder problem.
content.location: following the southwest edge of St. Paul. Walk off the back/north side to get down.

content.description:
Rock looks like a butt.

Very easy offwidth.
content.location:
Pretty much straight forward from the start of the trail. The boulder is at the top of the hill

GPS coords: N 33.56468° W 117.25838°

content.description: Crux at the move right before top-out.
content.location: on the back side of The Praying Hands. Work your way from the east side to the west side.
